Text:
The "Missing Orphans 
 Case"... I should ask 
 Chaz about it next time 
 I see him.
That's nice, \n that's real nice.
I am the listener of \n those whose voices \n cannot be heard...
He's just what \n Hekseville needs!
I was flying like a \n superhero!
Yeah, saw you \n slackin' off too.
Hear me. You must gather \n the small lights to \n create a big one.

I just hope they're not 
 those rebels... This 
 town has already gone so 
 far downhill.

The new mayor's pretty 
 popular. I guess it 
 makes sense, he's a nice 
 guy, and smart too.
Kat! Where'd \n you come from?
Why not just \n move then?

No-No, she's not my 
 daughter. She's a girl 
 under my protective 
 custody.
I saw some fishy types \n riding strange flying \n vehicles into town.
Yep! \n We had a lotta fun!
Okay...
I have to run over to \n the station...
Thanks for the \n help today, talk \n to you later!
Little girl, did the \n nice woman take good \n care of you?

Something tells me 
 she's more afraid of 
 Bulbosa than the 
 other officers...
Sorry to keep ya \n waitin'!

And well, this 
 little girl wasn't 
 too thrilled about 
 being left with 'em.
What do you mean? \n I wasn't talking \n to anyone.
You were talking to \n yourself. Practicing \n your ventriloquist act?

I heard Mayor Brahman 
 has converted a 
 government airboat for 
 his home.
An... orphanage?
Guess he wanted to make \n sure he could always be \n out close to the city.
Guess the orphanage will \n take care of her now.
Huh!? You want me to \n babysit your daughter?
I guess you don't have \n anyone else to ask, \n okay, I'll do it.

She lost her family to 
 the accident we're 
 investigating. She's an 
 orphan.
Just look after her \n until I get back, okay?
Listener of those whose \n voices cannot be \n heard...
So, what happens to her \n now, if you don't mind \n me asking?
Ah, but I'm just \n smacking my gums...
Sure, you take care! \n We'll play again \n someday.
But I didn't have \n anyone to watch her \n while I was gone.
So glad I ran into you! \n I've gotta favor to ask.
Could you look after \n this little girl for me?
I hope we can stomp out \n those rebels before they \n cause any more trouble.
You mind playing with me \n until the scary old man \n gets back?
Oh yeah, I was helping \n the police.

It seems strange 
 there'd be rebels 
 when the mayor is 
 such a good guy.

Oh, it's not like the 
 old place we had. 
 Security's as tight as 
 it gets there.
Thanks a bunch!
Hey, you! I saw you \n durin' the mayor's \n inauguration speech!
Heya, little miss!
Aki? Who are \n you talking to?

Especially after the 
 problem with those 
 kidnappings three 
 years ago.
The only ones I could \n ask were some scary \n characters in the force.

The police have really 
 stepped up their efforts 
 to make sure it doesn't 
 happen again.
Thanks for playing \n with me!
Dr. Brahman's speech was \n fantastic! I love his \n ideas...
I remember posters from \n the kidnappings...

I wish you two would 
 stop wasting so much 
 time finding things to 
 nitpick with me!
*sniff*
Aki was acting strange, \n even for Aki...
The "Missing Orphans \n Case" was Syd's old \n case.
Keep on like this, and \n you'll stay Kali's \n assistant forever.
Maybe I'll have a look around downtown today.
Ah, there you are! I was \n just looking for you.
I heard you lived in the \n area, but I had no idea \n where...
Yeah, my home's \n not easy to find.
So, what was it you \n needed?
Something very, very \n important! Of the utmost \n importance!
The mayor himself \n requested you.
I'll explain the rest on \n the way. I'll bring the \n airboat around.
I guess if the mayor's \n asking, who am I to \n say no?
The rebels that \n interrupted the \n inauguration ceremony...
They had an ulterior \n motive.

They used the chaos as a 
 cover to steal an 
 important storage case 
 from us.
Storage case? What was \n it storing?
A rare material vital to \n a new project for \n keeping the city safe.
To be honest, even I \n don't know exactly what \n it is...
But it's my fault for \n letting my eyes off of \n the case.
The mayor was quick to \n forgive me...
But I still feel like \n it's my responsibility \n to get it back.

I decrypted their 
 communications protocol 
 and traced them to where 
 they're hiding.
The mayor suggested I \n ask you for help.
Would you be willing to \n help us find and recover \n the case?
Of course! It's my turn \n to return the favor to \n the mayor.
My job with the new \n project hinges on \n getting that case back.
Anything you can do \n to help would be much \n appreciated.
Little Girl: \n The old guy said not to wander off...
Okay, let's head back then.
Little Girl: \n Hahahaha!
I better not wander off without her...
Little Girl: \n Take me up to the tippy top!
Little Girl: \n So... Whatcha gonna do?
Hmm, how about this?
Grab the Little Girl \n in a Stasis Field
Little Girl: \n Where ya goin'?
Little Girl: \n AAAH! I don't like this!
Oops, went too far...
Little Girl: \n AAAh! I'm scared!
Uh-oh, probably shouldn't have done that.
Little Girl: \n Wow! What's going on?
Wanna go for a little stroll?
Little Girl: \n Sure!
Little Girl: \n I wanna float more!
Escort the Girl around the Square
Little Girl: \n Oooh, I'm floating.
Little Girl: \n Look at me, I'm in the sky!
Little Girl: \n This is amazing!
Little Girl: \n Can we keep going?
Little Girl: \n Aah! I'm scared!
Sorry, sorry. Went a little too far there.
How you doin'? Not scared?
Little Girl: \n I'm fine! Go faster!
Okay, here we go!
Use the Gravity Slide
Little Girl: \n This is great!
Little Girl: \n Go! Go!
Little Girl: \n Zoom zoom!
Little Girl: \n Can we slide?
Little Girl: \n Aah, I'm scared!
Sorry, took that a little too far.
Little Girl: \n Hehe, this is cool!
Little Girl: \n Hey, can you get up there?
Escort the Girl to the Top \n of the Lookout Tower
Sure, let's go.
Little Girl: \n Ooooh.
Little Girl: \n Everything looks so tiny.
Little Girl: \n Let's go higher! How about that place with the apple?
Move to the Top of the \n Building with the Apple
That apple up there? Sure, let's go!
Little Girl: \n You think you could eat that apple?
Little Girl: \n Almost there...
Little Girl: \n ...
What's wrong, you're not afraid of heights, are you?
Little Girl: \n No, I was just looking for my house.
Want me to help you find it?
Little Girl: \n Nah, it's okay. We should go back to the old guy.
Escort the Girl Back to Bulbosa
Guess it is time to take you back.
Little Girl: \n Thank you, I had a blast!
Little Girl: \n Hey, old guy!
Find the Storage Case
Rebel: \n What the-!?
Hey! Get back here!
Guess I'd better find another signal.
The real thing has to be here somewhere.
I'll keep looking...
Better take out this false signal.
I need to take out the false signal.
The sensor spotted something.
Over there!
A signal, I should check it out.
Here's the equipment \n you'll need to carry out \n your mission.
Huh? A radio?
A special radio.

It'll react to even 
 minute traces of the 
 material in the storage 
 case.
So all you need to do is \n follow the signal.
Got it!
That's...
Found it!
Another false signal, better take it out.
Come on, another false signal!?
This isn't the case either, better handle it.
Huh? Is this the storage \n case? Something looks \n off...
But the sensor is going \n wild... I'd better check \n with Adicca.
*Beep* *Beep*
Adicca here.
It's me, I followed the \n sensor to a \n weird-looking machine.
I'll analyze the data \n spectrum on my end...
It's a dud! The rebels \n must've planted a decoy.

Whatever that machine 
 is, it must be designed 
 to put out the same 
 signal as the case.
Destroy that and any \n others you come across.
Right!
It's close...
It should be around here somewhere.
It's right nearby.
I need to find that case for Dr. Brahman.
This is Carrier One, HQ, \n do you copy?
We copy, Carrier One.
I'm on my way with the \n package, but my stingray \n is malfunctioning.
I can't maintain speed, \n so I'm having trouble \n transporting the target.
I'll bet that's the guy \n who took the case!

I've placed the decoys, 
 but it's only a matter 
 of time before they 
 find me.
I need reinforcements.
That's far enough! Give \n me back what you stole!
I'm never gonna catch \n him like this.
I need to use my Gravity \n Kick to stop him!
One more kick \n should do it!
Wha- What's that?
Kali!
Shifter, I was worried \n whether or not you were \n up to this...
But it looks like you \n actually managed to \n accomplish something.
I'll make sure this gets \n to Dad.
You just keep them busy.
Hold on! Tell me, what \n was in the case that was \n so important?
Nothin' to do with you, \n don't worry. Ta for now!
Wait!
Hmm... Guess I'd better \n call Adicca.
*Beep* *Beep*
He's not responding. \n What now?
Ah!
Overload detected! \n Emergency cooling system activated.
Yunica!
Long time no see, \n Sea Cat.
Permet...
Fall back!
Yunica, Permet, why are \n you doing this?
As part of the Jellyfish \n Anti-Nevi Special Forces \n Unit...

It's our job to take 
 back from Brahman what 
 rightfully belongs to 
 us.

We've been following 
 former mayor D'nelica's 
 orders to go underground 
 with Commander Yuri.
Brahman is dangerous - \n maybe the most dangerous \n man we've ever seen.
We know you're working \n for Brahman now.
And that makes \n you our enemy.
What are you talking \n about? Mayor Brahman \n is a good man.
You're just confused! \n I'm sure Commander Yuri \n is too.
Sea Cat... You're the \n one who's confused.
About what? Explain it \n to me then.

You don't even have the 
 faintest idea what 
 you're helping him to 
 do?
Gravity Queen, what's \n taking so long?
Don't tell me those \n pests were too much for \n you?
Kali... What are you \n doing back here?
Dad sent me \n to fetch you.
I... I have some things \n I need to think about \n first.
Dad's not a patient man.
This will help us \n carry out the City \n Preservation Project...
But it's not enough. \n We need another Angel.
That's why I called \n you. Gravity Queen, \n I need your help.
What do you \n mean you need \n another Angel?
My apologies. \n Allow me to \n explain.
Time is cruel. \n It causes everything \n to wither and decay.
I've spent the last years of \n my life searching for a way to \n control the ravages of time.
When I learned about my daughter's \n rare disease and how little time \n she had left, I made a decision.
I'd save her from time itself.
I left my lab, and, from \n home, pursued my work \n to save her.
But, instead of \n freezing the disease's \n progression...
I accidentally imprisoned \n her in time.
A second for her is thousands \n of years for me. Time has \n created a gulf between us.
But in my despair, \n I had a vision.
There, from the blackest \n darkness, I was inspired.

If I could do for the 
 city she loved what I 
 did for my daughter, we 
 could be together again.

It's the perfect plan. 
 The world and all of its 
 beauty will be preserved, 
 forever.
Wonderful, don't \n you agree?

Preserved... You mean 
 you want to stop time? 
 How's that supposed to 
 help anyone?
Towns and people change. \n That's what gives us hope, \n that's what gives us dreams.
I want to see Newt and \n Echo's baby. I want time to \n keep doing what it does!
I'd rather be dead \n than become some \n frozen statue.
What did you \n do to Adicca!?
I just stopped \n time for him.
We no longer \n shared the same \n vision.
How-
I'm asking one more time. \n Will you help me?
Don't touch me!
Brahman, \n you're insane!
Underneath the warm-hearted genius \n exterior of the mayor, Dr. Brahman...
There lurked a monster, and the revelation, \n when I discovered just how twisted he was, sent me reeling. \n I had to get away, so I ran and kept running.
Such a shame. I had \n such high hopes for you, \n Gravity Queen...
Rebel Radio: \n Code K! Launch all stingrays in pursuit.
Take Down the Rebels
You want a fight? You've got one!
You should know when to give up!
I have to take down the terrorists.
Defeat the Powerful \n Rebel Pair
They won't be as easy to take down as the others...
Why are they so strong?
Why does it feel like I've seen this fighting style before?
I can do this!
They're so strong...
I'm not going to give up!
Just a little more...
I have to take down those two terrorists!
Rebel: \n Fall back! Fall back!
Rebel: \n Emergency! Equipment failure.
Rebel: \n Being pursued by Sea Cat.
Rebel: \n Can't compensate... Need immediate assistance.
Rebel: \n Understood, heading to the designated airspace.
Rebel: \n On target to designated airspace.
Rebel: \n Sea Cat is still in pursuit.
Rebel: \n Uniting with reinforcements, entering defensive formation.
Rebel: \n As long as I don't take another hit, I can hold it together.
Rebel: \n Leaving airspace, heading to the rendezvous.
Got him!
I need to keep it up!
Rebel: \n Taking damage from Sea Cat, need assistance!
How'd you like that!?
Is this working?
Rebel: \n Damage to the craft, can't shake pursuit.
Rebel: \n Continuing to take damage, I need help now!
Stay out of my way!
You're making this harder than it has to be!
Go away already!
Rebel: \n I'm hit!
Rebel: \n I'm out! Just keep flying!
Pursue the Rebel
I have to catch him!
Shoot, they got away!
Shoot, they got away!
Land a Gravity Kick
I need to time my Gravity Kick just right.
I couldn't pull it off...
Land One More Gravity Kick
I can't let 'em get away.
Shoot, they got away!
Land a Gravity Kick
Land One More Gravity Kick
More of 'em!?
I have to hurry and stop him!
Signature Reaction
I-I see... Well, guess \n I'll just be going \n then...

Horrible thing that 
 was... Gets me right in 
 the gut just thinkin' 
 about it.
But more than anything, \n I love his voice. So \n mature.
Kali Angel called you \n out on it. You need to \n step up your game.
Anyone involved seemed \n to go missing.
Like you could leave \n everything to him and \n he'd get things done.
